title: The shield nerfs hit jungle Sion far harder than lane Sion
body:
Here's the specific nerf from 5.8:

Soul Furnace

* Shield's health ratio reduced to (+ 6 / 7 / 8 / 9 / 10% of max. health) from (+ 10% of max. health) at all ranks.
* Secondary cast cooldown increased to 3 seconds from 2.

Doing my first and second clear after the nerf, my shield was popped about 5 out of 6 times before I even managed to detonate it. This seriously cripples his first clear. The blue buff monsters all popped my shield with 1 AA a piece. The context you guys provided was that this nerf was targeted at lane Sion, and that Soul Furnace was too powerful in lane because the damage scaled with health, making building health counter-productive. How exactly does this nerf change that fact?

Would Armor or Health quints make the shield hold?

It would help, but early on (as in first+second clear) it would still be tricky to get it off if it took any damage. I'd probably opt for the extra armor over the extra health, because it would give you more total shield strength. Right now, without maxing it first you have a shield for 30 (+6% Max HP). 3 Health Quints give 78 HP or an extra 4.68 health on your shield (not much). 3 Armor Quints give 12.78 armor, which gives an extra 8.5 - 9.5 health on your shield (from level one to level 3 after clearing gromp and both major buffs). Either way, the health scaling nerf hit him very hard, because even with very defensive runes and masteries, it will still only shield him for about 65 - 75 health (again, depending on level and your health bonus), which breaks instantly to Raptors, Wolves (until level 3), Krugs, Gromp, Red, and Blue. Unless you put ranks into it almost immediately (like W>Q>W>E>Q>Q...) your clear really suffers along with your sustain putting that second point in at level 3 would allow it to not break on first hit when fighting Wolves, Gromp, *maybe* Raptors (not quite sure), and *maybe* Krugs. It would still break to red or blue buff unless you only get hit by the small monsters first.

all of you people saying how the change does not affect jungle sion obviously do not play jungle sion.

1. The shield is now too weak to take a *single hit* from some camps.
2. An extremely important part of jungle sion clear was a second activation of shield to finish off a camp. This shield will now get popped before you can activate it.
3. The added second before activating translates directly to an added second of cooldown, so it really hurts his clear speed since shield is not ready in time to start camps.

I'd be ok with one or the other nerf, but both together crippled his jungle. His shield is now pathetically weak early on (and was his main clearing tool), but you also can't reactivate it as quickly meaning you are a very lucky guy if you get the explosion without just blowing it up before taking damage. Riot ruined my favorite jungler in the game because they are too thoughtless with their nerfs to different roles.

Sion jungle still has a positive win rate.

Before the W nerf, Sion basically didn't ever have to back in the jungle if he didn't want to. I have first backed with over 3,000 gold and almost no health lost in the jungle as Sion, back when his W was that good.

Can he do that anymore? No, not really. Is jungler Sion bad now? Nope. Stop crying and accept that he isn't as strong as he used to be, but is still quite good.

Now his W is best used to speed clearing up. Max Q for quicker clear times, and start your shield before your Q knocks the camp up. Then, pop it. Easy enough.

He has such a high winrate because practically NO ONE counterjungles in soloQ. Now he gets so low during his first clear that if you jump him at his second buff he has to either burn flash or die. Meanwhile top Sion will remain borderline pick-or-ban in top lane despite these changes because the problem of being completely unable to defensively build against Sion's multitude of means to deal damage in lane remains a problem.

The shield changes hurt lane Sion a lot harder than jungle Sion.

In lane, the shield pop delay doesn't touch jungle Sion because you can start it early and pop it at the camp, while the delay is a really problem for lane Sion because his enemies can destroy it before it gets popped a lot easier.

In lane, the shield power decrease at early levels hurts for a lot longer because lane Sion maxes it last (instead of first for jungle Sion). It hurts both, but jungle Sion doesn't feel it as long because he brings his shield back to its old values a lot earlier. This also doesn't include the fact that Sion's opponents and jungle camps can pop the shield pretty easily at early levels, so there isn't too much of a difference there.

The shield changes do nerf Sion a lot, but they don't hurt jungle nearly as much as lane Sion.

A lot of people are saying "just use your shield before you fight" which only applies to to when you are starting a camp.

The bigger problem is that when already fighting them after you detonated you shield at the start of the camp, the jungle monsters, due to their attack speed and damage, can pop Sion's shield just before you hit the 3 second mark. This is a very large loss of damage to the major camps as before, or even if the secondary cast cooldown was only 2 seconds still, you would be able to detonate your shield for the 10% hp damage.

I suggest keeping the reduced health ratio since it was a bit nuts, but reverting the secondary cast to 2 or 2.5 seconds so you can just pop you shield just before it goes down from the jungle monsters on your first two clears. This will improve lane Sion slightly, but most champions should be able to take down the reduced shield before 2 - 2.5 seconds.
